samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. It was initially released in 1995. R is an implementation of the S programming language combined with lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme. The R language has since become widely used in statistical computing, data analysis, and research, and is now developed by the R Core Team.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. It was initially released in 1995. R is an implementation of the S programming language combined with lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme. The R language has since become widely used in statistical computing, data analysis, and research, and is now developed by the R Core Team.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: Version 1.0.0 of R was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R, though development of the language had begun several years earlier in 1993 by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

Version 1.0.0 of R was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R, though development of the language had begun several years earlier in 1993 by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.
